title: Ibrahimovic takes exception to rival fan's gloating by grabbing his CROTCH on way off pitch
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic bowed out in controversial fashion at LA Galaxy on Thursday night by grabbing his crotch in an angry showdown with a rival LAFC fan - before taking aim at MLS in his post-match interview.

In a series of events perhaps typical of his colourful career, Ibrahimovic - obviously disappointed at his team's 5-3 Western Conference semi-final defeat in Los Angeles - first took exception to one fan's gloating on his way off the pitch.

There is some uncertainty over his future both as an LA Galaxy player and as a professional overall at the age of 38, and it was always likely he would go out in style.

On his way off the pitch, Zlatan Ibrahimovic spotted one LAFC fan gloating in his face

Ibrahimovic took exception to the masked man and grabbed his crotch as he walked past

Zlatan has a last goodbye for a heckling LAFC fan, the Marshawn Lynch memorial crotch grab pic.twitter.com/2Z1Y2aSbsw — CJ Fogler (@cjzero) October 25, 2019

As he walked from the pitch following his team's exit against their rivals, the former Manchester United striker spotted one LAFC supporter taking his celebration to the next level.

Slowing down his exit, the Swedish striker turned to face the fan and grabbed his crotch, before smiling and being ushered down the tunnel by officials.

One LAFC staff member also appeared to attempt to confront Ibrahimovic after the gesture, but he was pushed away by a member of the Galaxy coaching staff.

After going down the tunnel, Ibrahimovic then took aim at Major League Soccer, VAR and LAFC in an explosive post-match interview an hour after the match.

When asked whether he would be continuing his career stateside, he said: 'What happens next year? I don't know. If I stay it will be good for MLS because the whole world will watch it. If I don't stay, nobody will remember what MLS is.'

A member of the LA Galaxy coaching staff tries to get between Ibrahimovic and the fan

The legendary striker smiles as he walks away, while another member of staff is stopped (left)

He was then questioned about the gesture he made to an LAFC fan as he walked from the field, responding: 'They said something.

'Not being disrespectful but this is like training for me. The stadium is too small for me. I'm used to playing in front of 80,000. This is a walk in the park.'

There was also a controversial VAR call during the match, in which an apparent offside goal was given in favour of LAFC. In response, Ibrahimovic said: 'What was he [the VAR official] doing upstairs? Drinking coffee with Magic Johnson?'

Ibrahimovic has yet to confirm details of his future and whether he will be hanging up his boots at the end of the 2019 season, which for Galaxy came on Thursday night.

The ex-Barcelona, Paris Saint-Germain, Juventus and Inter Milan striker has been linked with a move back to Europe, but nothing has yet been decided.

Ibrahimovic scored what could turn out to be his last ever goal as a professional footballer

Zlatan was likely holding back news of his future so as not to disrupt his team's attempts to win the MLS Cup this season.

They headed into Thursday's conference semi-final against LAFC with high hopes, but were eventually downed 5-3.

Ibrahimovic did get on the scoresheet to level things up at 2-2 in the second half, but Adama Diomande scored a brace - to add to Carlos Vela's in the first half - to take LAFC through to the Western Conference finals, where they will play Seattle Sounders.

Atlanta United will face Toronto in the Eastern Conference final, before the winners meet in the MLS Cup final on November 10.
description: In a moment perhaps typical of his colourful career, Ibrahimovic - obviously disappointed at his team's 5-3 semi-final defeat in LA - took exception to one fan's gloating on his way off.
